titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the M. M. Shneyeroff papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by M. M. Shneyeroff and Hoover Institution Archives Staff.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-08-23T14:24-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Memoirs, writings, and photographs, relating to the Russian revolutionary movement in the early twentieth century.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Quotations limited to 500 words consecutively, and to 5000 words from any manuscript.
For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], M. M. Shneyeroff papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1959.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the library catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Member of the Russian Socialist Revolutionary Party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Memoirs, writings, and photographs, relating to the Russian revolutionary movement in the early twentieth century.

did.unittitle: Memoirs written in Russian. In two parts, 304 and 168 pages.
A biographical essay under the title "My Last Arrest and the State Prison of Kursk" which is an English translation by the author of an excerpt of his memoirs.
A biographical essay under the title When I Was Young. This item was later added by Mr. Shneyeroff.
Three photographs (Victor Chernov in 1930, Breshko-Breshkovskaya, with a dedication on the reverse of the photograph. This was donated by Mr. Shneyeroff to the Hoover Institution.
A receipt by Breshko-Breshkovskaya for a loan of 27,000 rubles, received from Mr. Shneyeroff, dated Yokohama, January 4, 1919.
A visiting card of the former chairman of the city Duma of Moscow, O.S. Minor, dated August 5, 1918.
A letter of the private secretary to Breshko-Breshkovskaya, M. Eroshkin, dated April 2, 1919, describing first impressions after arrival of Breshko-Breshkovskaya in U.S.A.
